festival.introText:
Big names, booming basslines, boutique festival in a bull field...it can only mean one thing... Moovin Festival is back for 2023 and promises to get you dancing to a music lover’s mix of bass, funk, soul, reggae, house and d&b until the cows come home. 

Now in its seventh year and from a humble beginning the small cow barn party that started with a few hundred people has organically grown to completely selling out last year and has now well and truly established itself as THE place to party on August bank holiday weekend. 

Not far from Manchester, yet feeling like another world,  Moovin takes place at the eco-friendly Whitebottom farm in the stunning countryside in Compstall. Through a magical canopy of trees, past lakes with waterfowl to greet you and with a breathtaking gorge welcoming you at the entrance, and that’s when the special weekend adventures really begin. 

"At the bottom of a tree-lined valley, a hay barn with a fat sound-system. A freewheeling crowd, no VIP red ropes, no hassle from the authorities, just music and good vibes" 90s free party? No. Moovin' festival, Manchester, ." - GROOVE ARMADA - 2018 

Whilst the lineups are big the capacity is purposely limited it's something the promoters continue to believe in to keep it friendly. This results in a compact and personal festival that is still raw and independent round the edges but all done with real love and care. This intimate affair has a counter-cultural feel and a devotion to booking the freshest acts, as well as surprisingly big names for a festival of its size.  It offers a laid back way to see or if you feel like it get up close and personal with your favourite acts, as well as discovering a diverse array of quirky bands, local talent, drumming outfits and deep digging DJs from across the musical spectrum.  With walkabout performers, fire shows, morning gong baths and yoga classes and a refreshing attention to details only touching the surface, there is a whole lot more to explore and a unique free-spirited vibe at this party that you just can't quite put your finger on. Moovin Festival really is like no udder!   

“I’ve been at Moovin Festival from its inception in one way or another and it’s great to see how its grown and still maintained a certain vibe that’s something very very special. 808 closed the barn stage in 2017 and was by far one of our highlights of the year." 808 STATE 

"Moovin Festival was my Hilight of the Summer.The Great Vibes, Music, Venue, the perfect organisation and all these Beautiful people made this Festival become my Favourite Worlwide" - LEE SCRATCH PERRY 

While Moovin 2023 will be the biggest yet in terms of headliners and weekend experiences, the personal feel is retained once again so for more adventures in the fields than ever before, make sure you head on down.

Moooooooooo x
festival.descriptionText: Skiddle is an official ticket outlet of Moovin Festival 2023. Get Moovin Festival tickets, news and information with Skiddle.com

reviews.title: Review of Moovin Festival 2022
reviews.body: Amazing chilled out messy vibes, love it! Excellent music  loved Graeme Park

reviews.title: Review of Moovin Festival 2022
reviews.body: Loved the vibe and atmosphere of the crowd and age group. Very well priced. Wish food options were slightly better. Too much repetitive D&B and not enough soul djs. Would have been nice to have had more bands on. Sadly, Roy Ayers was disappointing as he had his mic turned off. possibly more room to camp. Would def go again. Cheers!

reviews.title: Review of Moovin Festival 2022
reviews.body: Ok no nobs apart from some silly b***h when trying to record a video of artist you paid to see

reviews.title: Review of Moovin Festival 2022
reviews.body: My first time at Moovin and loved it. Really well organised and a lovely energy. Great blend of live acts and DJs with enough variety to suit everyone. Loved that it was small, and so friendly! It looked like all the DJs and performers were also having a great time! Thank you to all involved.

faqs.question: When is Moovin 2023?
faqs.answer: Moovin Festival returns for 2023 on Friday 25th August to Sunday 27th August.

faqs.question: Does Moovin have onsite camping?
faqs.answer:
Yes, Moovin has a variety of camping options available, from staying in bell tents to campervans. There is also the option of a ‘quiet(ish)’ camping area. 

However, if camping is not for you, there are plenty of accommodation options within the local area with good transport connections to the festival site.

faqs.question: How much are Moovin tickets?
faqs.answer: Weekend tickets start from £100 + booking fee with camping available to be added on for an additional £25 +booking fee.

faqs.question: How do I get to Moovin?
faqs.answer:
By Car - The site is only 15 minutes from Stockport and 30 minutes from Manchester City Centre. Once you have arrived there are three carparks available.

By Bus - Stockport Train Station has buses which leave every 15 minutes to the village.

By Rail - The nearest stations to the festival site are Marple, Romiley and Stockport.

By Car

If you are coming by car use SK6 5HZ, this will take you to the Post office in Compstall and the site is signposted from there. 

There are three available carparks.  

The best one for campers is 5 minutes from the entrance of Etherow Country Park, it costs £10 for the weekend and the Sat Nav postcode is SK6 7HX.

For day ticket holders there is a carpark at the entrance of Etherow Country Park, Sat Nav SK6 5HZ.  If you did end up leaving your car there you will need to renew your ticket at 9am though….!

The Farm is an eco farm and only limited vehicles are allowed onsite, however shuttle buses to the site are available from both of these car parks for a small fee, or if you are feeling  fit, the 15 minute walk to the site is beautiful.

There is also a free car park facing Marple Train Station further up the Road, Sat Nav SK6 7DA. The shutttle bus will not be running from here, however you can walk, get bus 383 or 384 or call 0161 427 0777 VIP Taxis to take you to the entrance of the park, where you can then get the shuttle bus or walk to the site itself.

Public Transport

If you are coming by Public Transport the nearest train stations are Marple, Romiley and Stockport train station is also nearby with buses every 15 minutes. You can get public buses 383 and 384 to Compstall from any of these stations and then either take the shuttle bus to the site for a small fee or make the beautiful 15 minute walk which will be signposted.

SHUTTLE BUS TIMES ARE YET TO BE CONFIRMED.

GETTING HOME – A Taxi rank is located a short walk across the road from the main entrance. The number to call is 01614270777 (VIP TAXIES).

 

------------------------------

Coach Tickets with Tuned In Travel:

As the official transport providers of Moovin festival, Tuned in Travel have an array of transport options available to choose from. Book a seat on a coach and meet like minded festival goers or get the fun started early in a private hire vehicle!

Return coaches available from Chorlton, Didsbury, Manchester and Stockport on all days of Moovin Festival.

For one way tickets please see our friends at Tuned in Travel  https://www.tunedintravel.com/events/moovin-festival-2022 and any queries please contact them at customerservices@tunedintravel.com 

 

 

Click here for info: https://www.tunedintravel.com/events/moovin-festival

faqs.question: Is there disabled access at Moovin Festival?
faqs.answer: Please email info@moovinfestival.com with your access or additional needs before purchasing tickets and Moovin Festival will do its utmost to accommodate you.

faqs.question: Where is Moovin Festival?
faqs.answer: Moovin Festival is situated in the village of Compstall at Whitebottom Farm which is just outside of Stockport and Manchester City Centre.  The postcode is SK6 5H

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer:
Unfortunately, we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.

 

Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Does Moovin have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: Yes, you must be 18 or over to attend Moovin Festival. It’s always best to carry your ID with you as a Challenge 25 Policy will be in place.

faqs.question: How can I access my tickets?
faqs.answer: You can access your RapidScan tickets at any time by heading to www.skiddle.com/orders or the 'my tickets' section of the Skiddle app.

faqs.question: Can I bring my own food and drink into Moovin?
faqs.answer: You may bring soft drinks with you onto site but no glass bottles will be permitted. Only alcohol purchased on site can be consumed on site, drinks packages will be available to order for those camping. There is also a wide selection of food caterers at Moovin, providing free range and ethically sourced food on site.

faqs.question: Can I leave a re-enter?
faqs.answer: Yes, please ensure you wear your wristbands and stick to the entry times.

faqs.question: Can I take my dog?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately, not. Only guide dogs will be allowed on site.

faqs.question: What are the set times?
faqs.answer: The set times will be released much closer to the festival.

reviewsDisplayFour.body: Really well organised & gets better every year

news.title: Moovin Festival 2022: Roy Ayers, Orbital, Louie Vega & more - Tickets on sale
news.summary: The weekend-long fiesta returns to Etherow Country Park over the August Bank Holiday, with its biggest lineup to date - featuring Roy Ayers, Shy FX, Orbital, Louie Vega and many more

news.title: Tickets for Moovin Festival 2022 go on sale
news.summary: Moovin Festival will be back in 2022 after hosting a phenomenal 2021 edition.

news.title: Moovin Festival: line-up revealed inc. Todd Terje and Basement Jaxx
news.summary: The Stockport festival celebrates house, disco, reggae, hip hop and more over the August Bank holiday weekend.
